text: <@U0PB67X4K> <@U11MANG9G> <@U0KPFAZNF> regarding <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3815> - the work was done while Greg was employed with LSE - I just happened to notice the erroneous header language and fixed it. An alternative would be to omit the copyright altogether.
I don't think he usually copyrights?

<@U0KM61BCP>: fair enough. I’m fine with either applying the “let’s not have copyright notices in scripts/bash/Makefiles/docker, … because it’s weird” policy, or having it there, with the author confirming the copyright/ownership… in a way, as part of the author’s sign-off.

<@U0KM61BCP>, <@U0PB67X4K>: Either way, I want(ed) <@U0KPFAZNF> to +2 whatever he is comfortable with (mainly/also for auditability). Hence my inline comment along with the `+1`…

Thoughts?
I was discussing his most recent work and he was trying to get State Street to respond as to how to handle... I think we agreed to omit the copyright
until his legal gets back to him
but for older stuff since he usually added copyright I used that without the year
but we basically copied that file from fabric to fabric-cop I believe
so it should actually be the same file
Then, let’s go ahead with that…
